turns.content:
Certainly! Here's an example of how the criteria could be applied to the different levels within a consulting firm's career development framework:

1. Associate Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a basic understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Writes clean and maintainable code. Contributes to the team's technical knowledge.
* Customer Engagement and Satisfaction: Works effectively with clients to deliver high-quality solutions that meet their needs.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients and team members.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering work on time and within budget.
* Ability to Deliver: Demonstrates the ability to deliver results, even in the face of challenging or ambiguous requirements.
* Efficiency: Demonstrates the ability to work efficiently and effectively.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates the ability to learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.
* Depth of Knowledge: Has a basic understanding of one or more technical areas.
* Breadth of Knowledge: Has a basic understanding of a range of technical areas.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work.
2. Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a solid understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Writes high-quality, maintainable, and well-tested code. Contributes to the team's technical knowledge.
* Customer Engagement and Satisfaction: Works closely with clients to understand their needs and deliver solutions that meet or exceed their expectations.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients and team members, and can explain technical concepts in a clear and concise manner.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget.
* Ability to Deliver: Demonstrates the ability to deliver results, even in complex or ambiguous situations.
* Efficiency: Demonstrates the ability to work efficiently and effectively, and can identify opportunities for process improvement.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates the ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work.
* Depth of Knowledge: Has a strong expertise in one or more technical areas, and can provide guidance to others.
* Breadth of Knowledge: Has a broad understanding of a range of technical areas, including emerging technologies and industry trends.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work.
3. Senior Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a deep understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Provides technical leadership and guidance to others on the team.
* Customer Engagement and Satisfaction: Works closely with clients to identify and address their needs, and proactively identifies opportunities to add value.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients, team members, and senior leaders, and can influence decision-making with their technical expertise.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget, even in complex or high-pressure situations.
* Ability to Deliver: Demonstrates the ability to deliver complex solutions that meet or exceed client expectations.
* Efficiency: Demonstrates the ability to work efficiently and effectively, and can lead process improvement initiatives.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates the ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work, and proactively seeks out new learning opportunities.
* Depth of Knowledge: Has a deep expertise in one or more technical areas, and can provide technical leadership and guidance to others.
* Breadth of Knowledge: Has a broad understanding of a range of technical areas, and can apply that knowledge to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work, and can lead and mentor others on the team.

These are just examples, and the specific criteria and levels may vary depending on the consulting firm's needs and culture.

makes sense. i would like to see mastery of self-starter, speed of learning new things by level 2, communication, reliability, customer engagement and satisfaction by level 3, and the balance by level 5

Sure, here's how the rubric could be adjusted to prioritize the criteria you mentioned for each level:

1. Associate Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a basic understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Writes clean and maintainable code. Contributes to the team's technical knowledge.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates the ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.
2. Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a solid understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Writes high-quality, maintainable, and well-tested code. Contributes to the team's technical knowledge.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates a strong ability to work independently and take ownership of their work. Proactively identifies opportunities for improvement and takes action to make things better.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates a strong ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients and team members.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget.
3. Senior Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a deep understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Provides technical leadership and guidance to others on the team.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work. Proactively identifies opportunities for improvement and takes action to make things better.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients, team members, and senior leaders, and can influence decision-making with their technical expertise.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget, even in complex or high-pressure situations.
* Customer Engagement and Satisfaction: Works closely with clients to identify and address their needs, and proactively identifies opportunities to add value.
4. Manager
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a strong understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Provides technical leadership and guidance to others across multiple projects and teams.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work. Proactively identifies opportunities for improvement and takes action to make things better.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients, team members, and senior leaders, and can influence decision-making with their technical expertise.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget, even in complex or high-pressure situations.
* Customer Engagement and Satisfaction: Works closely with clients to identify and address their needs, and proactively identifies opportunities to add value.
* Efficiency: Demonstrates the ability to work efficiently and effectively, and can lead process improvement initiatives.
5. Senior Manager
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a broad technical expertise and a deep understanding of the firm's technology. Provides technical leadership and guidance to others across the firm.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work. Proactively identifies opportunities for improvement and takes action to make things better.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients, team members, and senior leaders, and can influence decision-making with their technical expertise.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget, even in complex or high-pressure situations.
* Customer Engagement and Satisfaction: Works closely with clients to identify and address their needs
now include technical skills, collaboration, and impact from google's list. i also forgot to mention that i want efficiency and any others i forgot from the consultant list mastered by level 3.

Sure, here's an updated rubric that incorporates the criteria you mentioned:

1. Associate Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a basic understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Writes clean and maintainable code. Contributes to the team's technical knowledge.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates the ability to quickly learn new technologies and adapt to changing requirements.
* Collaboration: Collaborates effectively with team members.
* Efficiency: Demonstrates the ability to work efficiently and effectively.
2. Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a solid understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Writes high-quality, maintainable, and well-tested code. Contributes to the team's technical knowledge.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates a strong ability to work independently and take ownership of their work. Proactively identifies opportunities for improvement and takes action to make things better.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates a strong ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work.
* Collaboration: Collaborates effectively with team members, product managers, and senior leaders. Communicates clearly and effectively in both written and verbal communication.
* Efficiency: Demonstrates mastery of the ability to work efficiently and effectively.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients and team members.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget.
3. Senior Consultant
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a deep understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Provides technical leadership and guidance to others on the team.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work. Proactively identifies opportunities for improvement and takes action to make things better.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work.
* Collaboration: Collaborates effectively with other teams, product managers, and senior leaders. Communicates clearly and effectively in both written and verbal communication.
* Efficiency: Demonstrates mastery of the ability to work efficiently and effectively, and can lead process improvement initiatives.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients, team members, and senior leaders, and can influence decision-making with their technical expertise.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget, even in complex or high-pressure situations.
* Customer Engagement and Satisfaction: Works closely with clients to identify and address their needs, and proactively identifies opportunities to add value.
* Impact: Makes significant contributions to the success of the company and the technology industry.
4. Manager
* Technical skills: Demonstrates a strong understanding of relevant technologies and tools. Provides technical leadership and guidance to others across multiple projects and teams.
* Self-Starter: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to work independently and take ownership of their work. Proactively identifies opportunities for improvement and takes action to make things better.
* Speed of Learning New Things: Demonstrates a mastery of the ability to quickly learn new technologies and apply them to the work.
* Collaboration: Collaborates effectively with other teams, product managers, and senior leaders. Communicates clearly and effectively in both written and verbal communication.
* Efficiency: Demonstrates mastery of the ability to work efficiently and effectively, and can lead process improvement initiatives.
* Communication: Communicates effectively with clients, team members, and senior leaders, and can influence decision-making with their technical expertise.
* Reliability: Demonstrates a consistent track record of delivering high-quality work on time and within budget, even in complex or high-pressure situations.
* Customer Engagement and Satisfaction: Works closely with clients to identify and address their needs, and proactively identifies opportunities to add value.
* Impact: Makes significant contributions to the success
